IdeaScale Feedback

Ideas and feedback for IdeaScale

Home

How does it work?

  • Users submit their ideas.
  • Our community discusses and votes for ideas.
  • The best ideas bubble up to the top.

Welcome to the IdeaScale Advisory Community

In this community you can submit an idea, vote on existing ideas or add your comments.

If you would like to submit an idea, please type in the box below or click the submit button. You will be asked to add a title and choose the category your idea belongs to. You also have the option to add a tag to your idea. Tags are another way to identify your idea using key words you feel describe it best. They can help others find your idea when browsing or searching. Tags are displayed in the left navigation area under What weâ€™re discussing.

If you would like to view ideas sorted by the categories, use the links on the left side of the screen under the heading Categories. To return to this page click the All Ideas link.

    Add "Abstain" to voting options instead of just up or down

    Give users the ability to 'abstain' from voting on a particular idea but still show the idea as voted on. With the vast number of ideas I try ...more »

    Give users the ability to 'abstain' from voting on a particular idea but still show the idea as voted on.

    With the vast number of ideas I try to not re-read them, but if there are some that I don't feel strongly about either way I won't vote. Then they still show the vote up or vote down buttons. If there was an option to abstain (think mark as read) that would help me manage Ideascale as a user.

    User Interface »

    Stop voting for In Progress and Complete

    Why continue to allow votes for those ideas in progress or complete? It makes no sense. It would make more sense to "simply" have a list of ...more »

    Why continue to allow votes for those ideas in progress or complete? It makes no sense.

    It would make more sense to "simply" have a list of ideas in progress or complete without seeing the votes. This way a user also doesn't ask "why is this one in progress when it received only 2 votes as opposed to another one that hasn't been done yet that has 17 votes?".

    So ... remove the ability to continue to vote on those in progress or already complete ... and don't even show the votes since that info is no longer relevant. The idea has already been "picked up".

    Submitted by christoph.klein 5 months ago

  • I agree
    Feedback Score

    +8
    -0
    I disagree
    This idea is active.
    Bugs/Issues »

    Indicate Moderators in comments

    Currently one cannot determine if a poster is a moderator or a regular community member without entering into the poster's profile. It would ...more »

    Currently one cannot determine if a poster is a moderator or a regular community member without entering into the poster's profile.

    It would be helpful to provide moderators with some indication next to their name when posting a comment that they are a moderator as to give some sense of official representation when responding.

    Currently any response just looks like another user and does not have as much urgency or authority as one would when people knew that it was an admin or moderator.

    A moderator should be a moderator at all times and not be able to slip in and out of that status. Their account is a Moderator account and thus in all cases they should be indicated as one. Allowing for commenting without moderation indication is being dishonest to their status and violates what I would establish as expectations of representation.

    Additionally there is a disconnect between posts that have been edited by a moderator and those that have status changed by a moderator. If someone comments in the Moderator box the post will put a "Moderator" comment down and no image will be shown while changes in the post review process will have a specific moderator's photo there with the action taken with no easy way to distinguish that the person is a moderator.

    Please correct this issue ASAP!

    « less full details »

    Also, I hope that if you add Custom Fields (or integrate IdeaScale with QuestionPro) someday that you will keep in mind that filtering is the key to narrowing down lists of ideas. For example, I may only want to see ideas that have a specific answer for a custom field (QuestionPro question).

    Submitted by Jonathan Brier 8 months ago

  • I agree
    Feedback Score
    6
    +6
    -0
    I disagree
    This idea is active.
    Community Development »

    Categories need some indicator that there are ideas in action

    It is confusing to open an IdeaScale panel and see (0) next to categories that you know you entered ideas into (because status changed). I think ...more »

    It is confusing to open an IdeaScale panel and see (0) next to categories that you know you entered ideas into (because status changed). I think it would be useful to customers to see two numbers or some other indicator to show the categories are not empty.

    For example, the category could be followed by an Active and In Action number.

    [Category] (Active) (In Action) or in example form: Reporting Tools (7) (1). This may not be the best way but something needs to show that there is content being acted upon in that category or people may not look there, or worse yet they will think their idea was deleted when in fact it may just be a change of status. Inexperienced users with the system will make this mistake frequently.

    Also, over time the number of items acted upon in the In Action category will grow and reinforce the concept that the customer is being listened to.

    « less full details »

    2 comments

    Submitted by Stew 2 years ago

  • I agree
    Feedback Score
    6
    +8
    -2
    I disagree
    This idea is active.
    Community Development »

    Cost/Numeric Component for Ideas

    I had a great conversation with a client (actually potential) about extending IdeaScale to provide for a costing model for ideas. As is typical ...more »

    I had a great conversation with a client (actually potential) about extending IdeaScale to provide for a costing model for ideas. As is typical with most businesses - feedback and enhancements are not FREE - everything has a cost associated with it. Currently with IdeaScale we are not focusing on capturing either the cost (or value) of any particular idea.

    On internal sites, this can be referenced as "Cost Savings" or "Revenue Generation" - Users (both who are posting ideas) as well as voting on them should be able to quantify the cost savings a particular idea will produce.

    In some cases, only the idea author may be able to define the cost/value, and in other cases both idea authors as well as voters can define the cost/value for an idea.

    One solution to this issue, is to come up with a Numeric (Enter $ Value) Custom Field on IdeaScale and use this as a model for reporting median values etc.

    « less full details »
